snippet: Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski met with political leaders a day after tens of thousands of protesters demanded his resignation over a wiretapping scandal.
abstract: Macedonian Prime Min Nikola Gruevski meets with opposition leader Zoran Zaev and other officials and representatives of United States and European Union, in response to mass protest over wiretapping scandal; Gruevski proposes forming working group to find solution, but Zaev insists on his resignation; protesters vow to remain outside prime minister's office until he steps down.

byline.contributor: Aleksandar Dimishkovski contributed reporting from Skopje, Macedonia.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski met with political leaders a day after tens of thousands of protesters demanded his resignation over a wiretapping scandal.

headline.main: Macedonia’s Leaders Unable to Resolve Festering Crisis
headline.print_headline: Macedonia’s Leaders Meet, but Political Crisis Remains Unresolved

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
